website_summaries.verdict: A change of scenery does the Far Cry shooter series good. Primal's caveman drama, beast-taming, and prehistoric hunting are highly satisfying, even though we've tread this ground before. Can we get dinosaurs next, please?
pros: Beautiful, highly detailed environments and creatures
Greater focus on melee and beast companions makes combat much more involved and personal
cons: Lacks impactful, eccentric NPCs, and story suffers for it
Gameplay doesn't evolve much past the first few hours and becomes repetitive

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as past editions
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as past editions. After a while it just seemed pointless. No real goal. But the graphic were awesome. This is a game to just stop and look around at the scenery. The original and the one after that were great and it has been a steady decline after that.
customer_reviews.author: Atis K. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Adore this game! I prefer Far Cry 3 BUT this is still a really good game. It took me many hours and days to complete. I like that you can almost make it as in depth or quick as you want. While you do have to complete certain main missions, there is a lot you can do outside of those if you choose. The story line is decent.The overall concept of the game isn't hard to figure out. I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Barum

customer_reviews.title: This game does not run on dual socket CPU workstation
customer_reviews.text: This game does not run on dual socket CPU workstation. In my case it was x72 logical cores dual E5-2696v3 64GB RAM WS. I had a multiple iterations with Ubisoft support (Ticket: 06270894), here is their verdict: "Have duel processors isn't supported with our games". You may also google something like "Far Cry Primal does not start" and read multiple hits for non dual socket CPU typical gamer's PC ... It's apparently a bogus product...
customer_reviews.author: olga buyanovskaya

customer_reviews.title: Long play and great graphics
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful graphics and long play time if you explore and take on all challenges. Not all weapons or resources are much use and find I stick to mostly the same beasts or weapons. I am looking forward to getting back to modern day weapons and challenges like previous versions but this is still a good game in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: wanted more
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the game, but it seemed like there should have been more story - quest-wise, character-wise, etc. It was fun to explore and hunt with a sabretooth tiger at my side, but the spawning quests were a chore pretty quickly. I wanted it to be a great game, but it is really just a good game.
customer_reviews.author: js7

customer_reviews.title: what a rip off!
customer_reviews.text: installation was ludicrous and then had to jump through a million hurdles to try to get the game to work but to my demise the piece of crap just keep making me download lots of "update" :-( what a waste!
customer_reviews.author: Hoggard

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the Best
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this game, the setting was terrific, and the story was not something that is overly used in many games, so it was a fun and unique view on a game. I especially enjoyed the beast taming parts of the game, and many of the side ventures were really interesting. The reason the game only got three stars was that many of the missions and side stories became very tedious. The game is all about survival, so the gathering of materials and building of tools became not only dull but monotonous. Overall I would say the game is worth playing, but it is far from the best in the Farcry series.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible (seems like) never ending landscape! Pleasant change from ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredible (seems like) never ending landscape! Pleasant change from "todays" setting shooter games. Going back in time is a interesting change though gruesome at times. Game plays extremely smooth.
customer_reviews.author: kc's corner

customer_reviews.title: Runs great on a 5930K and a 1080Ti
customer_reviews.text: To crush my enemies, see them driven before me, and to hear the lamentation of their women.

customer_reviews.title: Big Tiger.
customer_reviews.text: I have fire and a stick. Seriously you need a good CPU to run this game without stutters.

customer_reviews.title: Different twist for Far Cry fans
customer_reviews.text: I liked it and am a long time fan of the Far Cry series and thought the primal aspect was a different twist. The story line is thin and the game play gets old after awhile but there are enough different things to do to keep you interested at least it kept me going for many hours.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight A. Griffith

customer_reviews.text: Not near as interesting as other games. Won't be buying later versions.

customer_reviews.title: Yabba-Dabba-Doooo!
customer_reviews.text: Take the fun exploration, base conquering, and skills/weapon progression systems of the FarCry games and infuse them into the Stone Age. Props to Ubisoft for trying something different and somewhat unique, and if you want a truly exploratory and caveman-esque experience, turn off most of your HUD elements!

customer_reviews.title: Far Cry Prime (PC) is amazing and it was my first purchase of this franchise
customer_reviews.text: There are not a lot of single-player games that keep me captivated to invest 60+ hours of play time within a week. Far Cry Prime (PC) is amazing and it was my first purchase of this franchise. I look forward to future content updates, especially the recently released “survival mode“.

customer_reviews.title: Far Inferior gameplay, very slow and boring

But if you played Far Cry 3 & 4, please do yourself a favor and dont ruin that experience by playing this game. Is far inferior and is not worth the money. I made a mistake thinking that will be at least ok. I am struggling to stay on it for more than 15' at the time and then close it bored and disappointing Limited weapons, slow story line, chaotic environment.. it doesn't have the grab on effect that far cry 3 & 4 have from the beginning. Very slow and unattractive Bad Job Ubi Soft, really bad job.

customer_reviews.title: Issues with UPlay, but game is great!
customer_reviews.text: U Play is crap. But the game is great. If you have the problem where the game is stuck (not loading) at the startup box thing, just add the game to Steam, open UPlay, and hit "play" from Steam and it launches correctly, and logs game play/cloud saves through Uplay, so long as it is open when you start the game up. Its sad that I have to use your competition to open your game. It is an issue that has been around since the release, and still no fix.

customer_reviews.title: Not a worth successor
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as good as the first 4. In the middle of Primal I stopped to replay Far Cry 3 just to remember how good the series could be. The storyline is weak to the point of non-existence. The graphics are awesome but that is so in most games these days so that's no reason to buy it. If you haven't played any of the Far Cry Games start with 3, then 4, then 1 and 2. Save this for last or even pass entirely. Three stars because it is not a bad game, it just doesn't measure up to its predecessors. I'd rate FC 3 and 4 at 5 stars each, FC 1 and 2 at 4 or so.

customer_reviews.text: Best far cry yet. Great story, amazing environment to play in. Easy download and almost all on the disk, just a short download at the end. Works very well on Windows 10. Who would not want to ride a sabertooth?

customer_reviews.text: Fun, but I keep finding myself missing guns :) I'd recommend this game if you are into Survival games, especially into Survival mode. But you're better off playing Far Cry 3 and 4 if you want a more traditional shooter.

I've updated my driver's and reinstalled the game. Still the same problem. Very upset since I was very much looking forward to this game.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible horrible horrible
customer_reviews.text: Horrible horrible horrible. It will not load onto my pc. My pc is cutting edge and this piece of crap will not load or play!!! Ubisoft support is non-existent!! If you try to call them you will get a message that they are busy, try their online support, then they hang up. Contact the online support and they dont answer. I want my money back Amazon!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible With Antivirus Software
customer_reviews.text: Can't even play this, because it is incompatible with my Bitdefender firewall. Creating specific file exceptions or even turning the firewall off completely (!) doesn't solve the issue. The company's "fix" thus far is to completely uninstall my antivirus software and reinstall it, which I can't do because I have a download-only version. Reading the boards it appears to be incompatible with most other popular firewalls as well, since they posted "workarounds" for Symantec and others as well. Really, Ubisoft? Given that they're running an online marketing model, this makes no sense at all. For me, this was a waste of sixty bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: So far it will not run on my pc. Waiting to hear from my post on the forum.
customer_reviews.author: samrisam

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty but will BSOD in about 10-15 min
customer_reviews.text: Typical Ubisoft/Uplay game. Looks pretty but will BSOD in about 10-15 min. of play. Don't know how this company stays in business. I run 16 GB with 970 geforce...everything up to date...works great on everything else. Absolute trash; I won't be purchasing anything from this company any longer.
customer_reviews.author: BC

product_meta.title: Far Cry Primal - PC Standard Edition
product_meta.description:
Platform:PC| Edition:StandardWelcome to the Stone Age, a time of extreme danger and limitless adventure, when giant mammoths and sabretooth tigers ruled the Earth, and humanity is at the bottom of the food chain. Learn to craft a deadly arsenal, fend off fierce predators, and outsmart enemy tribes to conquer the land of Oros and become the Apex Predator.

The award-winning Far Cry franchise that stormed the tropics and the Himalayas now enters the original fight for humanity’s survival with its innovative open-world sandbox gameplay, bringing together massive beasts, breathtaking environments, and unpredictable savage encounters.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER

MINIMUM PC CONFIGURATION 
OS: Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 (64-bit versions only)
PROCESSOR: Intel Core i3-550 | AMD Phenom II X4 955 or equivalent
VIDEO CARD: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460 (1GB VRAM) | AMD Radeon HD 5770 (1GB VRAM) or equivalent 
SYSTEM RAM: 4GB
HARD DISK: 20 GB
PERIPHERALS: Windows-compatible keyboard, mouse, headset

RECOMMENDED PC CONFIGURATION 
OS: Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 (64-bit versions only)
PROCESSOR: Intel Core i7-2600K | AMD FX-8350 or equivalent
VIDEO CARD: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 780 | AMD Radeon R9 280X or equivalent
SYSTEM RAM: 8GB
HARD DISK: 20 GB
PERIPHERALS: Windows-compatible keyboard, mouse, headset

Supported Video Cards at Time of Release: AMD Radeon HD 5770 (1 GB VRAM) or better, HD 7000 / 200 / 300 / Fury X series, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460 (1 GB VRAM) or better, GTX 500 / 600 / 700 / 900 / TITAN series
Note: This product supports 64-bit operating systems only. Laptop versions of these cards may work, but are not officially supported. For the most up-to-date requirement listings, please visit the FAQ on Ubisoft support website.
Peripherals: Windows-compatible keyboard, mouse, optional controller
feature_bullets: Stone Age By Far Cry: Enter an open world sandbox filled with the unpredictable chaos and peril that the Award-winning Far Cry franchise is known for.
Rise Above Extinction: Defeat the deadly tribes of Oros with all new weapons and tools in the original fight for humanity’s survival.
Control Epic Beasts: Tame every predator and choose how you use their specific skills to slay your foes.
Discover the Deadly World of Oros: Fight to survive amid lush redwood forests, harsh taiga, frozen tundra, and murky swamps.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars171 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
